website_summaries.verdict: Double straps make a big difference in keeping these boots on, but the bottom strap can irritate some dogs’ paws.
pros: Wide opening with foam padding and double straps makes boots easy to put on and hard to fall off
cons: Size tends to run a bit small
Boots can irritate dogs’ nails, particularly dew claws
A few owners had trouble getting the right fit for their dogs’ paws

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable but not as durable as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought the boots for my Newfoundland who of course has some large paws and needs durable boots for walks in the neighborhood and outdoor wear. She has worn them only twice and the toes at the sole seams of these boots already have holes in them. These are simply not as durable on the bottoms as I had hoped, and I don't expect them to hold up for long wear. For truly "durable" boots for a large / giant breed dog, these have unfortunately not met the description.
customer_reviews.author: K Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible! Ruined in ONE Use
customer_reviews.text: We thought these would be a good option, because the balloon booties are only temporary. These lasted ONE DAY. We only use two, on our pups back feet, and there are holes in them after one usage. They were delivered on August 15th. DO NOT WASTE your money on this product. We didn't even run with them; we used them in the pool only! Our pup likes to push off of the steps, in the pool, and swim. That's all these were for, to protect his nails and paws, from the stairs inside the pool. A photo is attached. Horrible. Just save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with Boots Design Changes
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a set of these boots previously and they were perfect for her. We walk 3 miles a day and these kept her feet dry and warm. When we needed new ones, obviously I chose the same brand, but they are not the same. The design has changed and they are more open and expected to close completely with the 2 velcro straps. My dog now has cold, wet feet. These are definitely better than no boots at all, but not an improvement in their design. I'm really disappointed. Price was not an issue with the 2nd pair. I just wanted the fit I expected from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: L  Carter

customer_reviews.title: Material of boot does NOT hold up on one day's use.
customer_reviews.text: Received the boots today and took my mini Australian Shepherd for a walk. Terrain was cement sidewalks, street asphalt and dirt walking paths. Wanted to protect dog against heat of pavement. We went 6 miles. Three of four boots seams came apart. The front ones wore the worst. The boots fit well (XS for a 1.75 paw size) but the material does not seem to be of a high quality and certainly not durable. I purchased on the recommendation of a non-Amazon website as well as reviews on Amazon. Returning and hoping for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: How large is not a large it is medium their sizes are way off
customer_reviews.text: Well the sizes are not correct the label says a large but when you compare it to any other booty it’s an extra large they didn’t provide measurements. There being fairly difficult to exchange the product. Don’t seem as durable as they say my dog tried them once we went for a five minute run two booty had some where in tear too. This was a very light use and they already started breaking down. The other boots that I got a cheap knock offs are still holding up much better than these so-called ultra durable not water resistant all. will not by again
customer_reviews.author: Master K

customer_reviews.title: Service Dog success!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has worn these twice and successfully! He’s been over a variety of terrain and romped in the snow. He acted as those he had nothing on! Well, he looked curiously at his feet as they clomped like horse hooves on the linoleum floor at the doctor’s office. Very cute! He doesn’t bite at them or object to them. It’s early days still but if I think of it next year and if they’re as good as I suspect they are, Ultra Paws will get 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Signe57!

customer_reviews.title: three years later
customer_reviews.text: Use these with our Doberman a lot. Funny to see how he'll dive onto the porch at a run and purposefully skid/slide on wet days, leaving long, muddy skid marks. Seems to enjoy it. Of course, it's devilishly hard to get him to go out and do his business if it's actually raining. Grrr. Plenty of scenes with umbrellas, rain boots, dog treats and coaxing/wheedling as the highway traffic passes by, probably chuckling. We've been very happy with these after using a number of other brands over the years (with other dogs ...) Noticed this morning that the black soles are wearing through. Time for a new set.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Boots that actually stay on
customer_reviews.text: These boots stay on my dog's feet! My 93 pound dog is very comfortable wearing them, and more importantly, the boots are protecting the hardwood floors. I've tried 3 other types of boots but always had an issue with the size, comfort for my dog or not staying on for more than a few minutes. My dog can run in these and they stay put. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Diortman

customer_reviews.title: Too Thin – Easily Worn
customer_reviews.text: My husband & I really liked these boots at first because they're easy to put on, they fit well enough, and they stay on. But sadly they don't last. On only the second walk they were starting to get worn on the bottoms, and now they have full-on holes in the lining – only a month after we purchased them and after only a few times using them! They're just too thin and not worth >$30 if you have purchase several pairs just to last the year.
customer_reviews.author: Emily A.

customer_reviews.title: Work very well for my dog
customer_reviews.text: These fit my 65 pound Golden Doodle really well. I was surprised at how good they stay on her when she is running around outside in the snow - once I figured out the trick to getting them on correctly. My only complaint after having and using these for a while is that the straps are constantly losing strings on the sides. It is very annoying. At this point it has not impacted how well the boots stay on and work, but I am concerned about the long-term quality of the product. See photos. I would buy these boots again, but hope the manufacturer fixes this problem.
customer_reviews.author: JCK

customer_reviews.title: Twist around on the dogs leg and paw
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of boots from this company and love them but these were awful. They slid around my dogs leg despite being the correct size. The foam that is supposed to keep them in place does nothing to help that. The other boots I have from the same company have the non slip material on the whole boot and those are great, these however I returned.
customer_reviews.author: devonnic75

customer_reviews.title: Works Great- Aging GSD
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my aging, 90lbs, German Shepherd as she is having difficulty getting up and walking on our hardwood floors. I put them on her (hilarious by the way, get a camera!) without too much difficulty. She hated the front ones but doesn't mind the back. They seem comfortable and they stay on good. She will hopefully get used to the front but so far the backs work great for what she needs right now. I take them off at night since she sleeps upstairs, which is carpeted. Figured it gives her feet a break and let's them breath. She wears them out to the bathroom but haven't tried walks as she's too old to go far .
customer_reviews.author: TheLeveques

customer_reviews.title: Buy bigger than suggested!
customer_reviews.text: We have Ultra Paws Rugged Boots in medium and bought the same for these however I cannot get my dogs foot into them. So now I have to go through the hassle of returning them and waiting for the larges to come in. And of course I wont get 1 day shipping now for it either. The material on top is thin enough to see light and actually feel air come into it. But its cushiony and seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: The best dog boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best dog boots! I used these for years for my 1st dog because his paws were very sensitive and things always seem to get stuck in his pads when hiking . I bought a 2nd pair for our other dog for the winter and it keeps his paws from freezing when the temps drop and it snows. These are the only boots that don’t come off when they run & play. Both dogs, who don’t like their paws handled, they let me put these on no problem...they seems to like it and were used to them in no time. Don’t waste your time with the others.
customer_reviews.author: starryskies

customer_reviews.title: Thought these would be awesome after all the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Thought these would be awesome after all the reviews. Package arrived in decent amount of time and the boots looked and felt of good quality, but after 2 walks with them, my dog has already worn a hole in 2 of the boots right at the seems. Guess I'll be looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: These are an awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size medium for my 55 lb Pit Bull and they fit great. He might have even fit into the next size down but these are comfortable for him. He's a huge baby when it comes to snow and the ground being cold. When we first put the boots on him, he was a bit bothered by them. But when we went outside you could tell something clicked in his head and he was so excited to do some doggy zoomies in the snow! Now he sits patiently while we strap them on every morning and night! Update: Be cautious around icy surfaces. I still love these boots but they have zero traction on slick icy surfaces!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan S

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Boots
customer_reviews.text: I thought the shape of the shoes were odd and that they were too stiff, but I have bought so many shoes for my dog and these are the only ones that make her walk on her hind legs properly. She usually walks (while on a wheelchair) on her knuckles because of the partial paralysis, but somehow these shoes correct the position of her paws that she is able to walk like a normal dog. I surmise it maybe the rubber padding inside that keeps her paws in the right position.
customer_reviews.author: Cecille Chan

customer_reviews.title: Get your dog used to wearing them BEFORE taking them for a walkabout!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit and protection for my dogs. Here in Arizona where everything stings, bites, pokes, or scratches they are a necessity for desert walks. Also protects from extremely hot pavement and rocks, a small investment to keep your dog comfortable and free from injuries. After a little practice, they secure well and won't fall off. As a suggestion, try them on your animal a few times at home to get used to putting them on your dog, and also getting the dog used to wearing them. They do fit true to size, Gunny on the left weighs about 120 pounds, got the large for him, Grrr on the right weighs about 80, he's sporting the mediums.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots. Confusing sizing chart.
customer_reviews.text: We bought many boots for our dog and these are definitely the best. Most dog boots will fly away once your dog starts running. These do not due to their smart design. I took one star away for the confusing sizing chart. I ordered the correct size based on my measurement, but the boots are too big. They need to update the sizing chart.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm loving these booties! My dog has tiny feet and slim ankles, and I've had a really hard time finding booties that stay on. This is probably the 4th or 5th brand I've tried since adopting her 3 years ago. So far the stay on great and keep her feet dry and clean. Some snow and mud has slipped in through the top but not much, and that's only when she goes in deep mud/snow. They're easy to clean and fairly easy to put on. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: dogmom3000

customer_reviews.title: 75 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog weighs 75 lbs. I measured his front paws and they were about 2.5-2.75", so I initially bought a Medium. The Medium fit very snug but was too difficult to get on and off, especially having to do so multiple times a day. The Large is much better, easy to get on and not too much extra material. Better than other boots I have tried in past. Boots stay on, are water resistant, and offer good protection from snow and salt.
customer_reviews.author: -SDCali

customer_reviews.title: Sole wear after only a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: They protect my puppy's feet from the hot pavement. However the soles are already wearing through. We typically walk in the very early morning or late evening when he won't be an issue, so they have not been used that much. I was hoping these boots would be a much more durable product than they are. (5 stars for performance -3 stars for lack of durability)
customer_reviews.author: Erich Zann

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Choice for Snow and Salt Covered Roads
customer_reviews.text: Our Cali dogs loved these boots on a recent trip to Utah. The salt on the road started irritating their feet. They realized these boots meant they were going for a long walk. They would sit calmly and let us put them on. The boots never came off, even in deep snow. Plus the dogs looked adorable in them.
customer_reviews.author: RacingRRR

customer_reviews.title: These would be perfect for a simple stroll when the ground is frozen ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my gsd when he injured one of his paw pads. It did the job protecting his pads, but failed to stay on his feet when running. Because my dog is very active, he needs to play fetch at the park twice a day. I needed boots that would stay on his feet while he ran full speed for the ball. The foam pads at the top of the boots helped to keep the boots on, but alas, my dog's activity level proved too much for these. These would be perfect for a simple stroll when the ground is frozen or when the pavement is too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Krystle

customer_reviews.title: These are great dependable boots, that's why I've been ordering these for years.
customer_reviews.text: These are the same brand I've been ordering for my dog for the last three years. They stay on and are somewhat easy to get on your dog. I put these on him for ice and snow and when the snow gets high, I put dog socks on before the boots. Most the time all I do is take off his boots when we come in and let him go because his feeltare usually clean and dry depending on the weather. I also don't have to worry about him getting salt stuck between his toes or ice balls as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Work Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my 15 year old Border Collie/Australian Shepherd because he was sliding and falling down on our wood floors with little success picking himself up. I bought and added the Dog Boots to his rear feet first and the difference was almost immediate. He could pick himself up again and figured out how to negotiate the single and double steps in the house, all because of these 'Dog Boots' that grip almost any surface. Were going up to Mammoth soon and I can't wait to see him with his boots in the snow(whatever is left) because last time his feet got too cold. VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: SteelHalo

customer_reviews.title: Not "Durable" at all!! Soles significantly worn down after only a few months. Non-existent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: We've been using the boots on our 18-pound shiba inu, as he's allergic to the grass in our condo's dog park. They've definitely helped with that problem but having only used them for a few months, the soles are now worn down and tearing. We haven't used them for any long walks, hikes, running, non-paved/rocky surfaces; simply for the short walk from our condo down to the dog park and back. At this rate, they won't last 6 months. Definitely not durable or for everyday use! Customer service was non-existent - my e-mail to Ultra Paws went unanswered. Disappointing when companies don't stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: DaKine77

customer_reviews.title: These Boots Are a Miracle!
customer_reviews.text: My nine-year-old, 155 pound Rottweiler Harley has been having some difficulty getting around, and several times slipped and fell on our hardwood floors. We bought these boots for him hoping it would help him with traction. He wasn't too sure about them at first, but with in a very short while he was walking around just fine. Not only that, he was smiling and wagging his tail and acting like the Harley of old. We think that his paws have been hurting him. The padding inside the boots gives his paws relief, and without the pain he is doing so much better. I can't recommend these enough for large older dogs. We are buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Lauri H.

customer_reviews.title: it has left her in pretty bad shape
customer_reviews.text: Our 70 lbs lab was attacked by a pack of coyotes. Thankfully she survived, however, it has left her in pretty bad shape. Her back was broken and several ribs. This has caused her to loose feeling in her hind legs. We have hardwood floors and she could no longer get around throughout our house. After reading other reviews, we ordered these boots. They work GREAT! She can get around our house now without slipping.
customer_reviews.author: mkeps33

customer_reviews.title: Work well for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My aged 100 lb dog has developed arthritis issues in his back legs. These help him get a grip on smooth, shiny surfaces. Easy to put on and take off. He doesn't mind them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Haskell

customer_reviews.title: They don't hold up
customer_reviews.text: After going out only twice with the durable boots, they were already showing signs of wear. Little holes. They did fit nicely. They are for my Mini Pen and I bought the x-small size. I know the Rugged boots would be better so I ordered those. Problem with the Rugged they don't come in x-small. Tried them and no holes on the bottom but they don't fit properly and one actually fell off on our run and I couldn't find it. Where we run it is rough asphalt and sometimes glass on the road. He really needs these boots because they protect he's feet but they aren't going to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: X-small fits my Sheltie perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Finally found booties that fit and stay on my Sheltie's feet. Thanks to the second strip of stretch VELCRO these booties do stay on pretty well. I must have bought & returned 5 different types before I found these. The problem I had with Ultra Paws is they're heavily padded inside ( a Good feature but it makes for a smaller fit when you go to push them onto dog's feet) so I had to try different ones before finding the x-small fit him the best. Small was HUGE ( could have fit Pitbull) and Petite were teenie because of thick padding.
customer_reviews.author: E. Constable

customer_reviews.title: The fit on them isn't quite perfect, but they don't seem to cause him discomfort
customer_reviews.text: My 11yo Black Labrador was having trouble on our wooden floors so we bought these for him. Now he can safely walk across them without falling, and has a much easier time getting up and down when he wears them. The fit on them isn't quite perfect, but they don't seem to cause him discomfort. The laugh I got watching him try to figure out what the heck was on his feet and walking like a clydesdale was a nice bonus too haha.
customer_reviews.author: Blitzed92

customer_reviews.title: These saved my old dog
customer_reviews.text: Without these boots my old dog would not be able to walk around the house at all. She is arthritic and has weak hips, and without these she cannot walk or stand on hardwood floors. She wears these morning to night all day. The first pair wore out in about 6 months and she's on her second pair. I tried another brand, Ruffwear, I believe that had a single strap and more traction thinking it would be better. While it did have better traction, it rubbed sores on her ankles in a few days. The ultra paws design with two straps and a soft foam on the ankle portion allows for long term wear without causing sores. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Paulina Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing boots for our Giant Schnauzer! It is easy to put on, and once it is on, it stays on. We have had the boots on our dog playing in snow for 30-45 minutes at a time, as well as 1-2 mile walks. I would recommend this to anyone who might be sitting there asking themselves should they buy this or should they not buy this. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Encarnacion Rodriguez III

customer_reviews.title: great beginner dog shoes!
customer_reviews.text: My dog let me put these on, no problem. I was shocked. He likes them! Only problem is that he gets really hot since they don't breathe, which is why they get 4 stars only. But if you want them for cooler months then they are probably fine! They stay on well and I like the rubber padding at the top. I guess I don't really know how it feels since he can't tell me, but it looks like it would make the shoes more comfortable. We went 6 miles and no paw problems besides the heat!
customer_reviews.author: paelladevalencia

customer_reviews.title: Great Product for hot or rough surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I take my dog with me when I ride my bike but she tries to get over to the grass because the road hurts her feet after a little while. I tried mushers secret paw wax but it doesn't really work for rough surfaces. These are great. She high steps for a little bit when I first put them on but once we get going she doesn't even notice them. They're also perfect for walking on hot pavement in the summer. I'll probably buy another set.
customer_reviews.author: Need More Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Made fairly well
customer_reviews.text: We tried several kinds and this one is at least made well, with a second strap to help keep the bootie in place. Our dog doesn't really like them (we use these only for really wet or snowy weather) but he get's used to them and it (1) protects his paws against salt used to melt snow and (2) helps keep our floors cleaner. I think the product could be improved to have some more flexibility at bending points. I should add that there is soft neopreme foam padding around the inside, which cushions the pay. The no-slip bottom does the job its supposed to. Overall, we'd purchase this again as we've found nothing better.
customer_reviews.author: melwest

customer_reviews.title: Godsend for older dogs
customer_reviews.text: These were a Godsend for my elderly lab who started slipping on our wood floors in his last years. He would hesitate and stay on the carpet because he was afraid of slipping. But the minute we put these on, he was visibly relieved and could roam the whole house. We used to call them his "Go Go Boots" because then he could Go anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Rambus

customer_reviews.title: I love these! But more importantly - my border collie ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these! But more importantly - my border collie loved them! She was a bit hesitant at first but after about 15 minutes she was comfortable and actually I think, enjoyed them! Easy to put on (if you have a malleable pile of putty like my dog is!) And we did a 2-3 mile walk to test them out. They were firmly fitted when I went to remove them. Now we're ready for the next snow storm! No more ice clots for our girl! I also took the recommendation and got her toenails clipped to avoid wearing holes through the fabric over time. Great purchase, well made, quick delivery, happy doggy!
customer_reviews.author: Wallflower

customer_reviews.title: stylish!
customer_reviews.text: fit is good, have a 100llb st bernard, and there is a bit of wiggle room. i bought them to help with traction as she is 12 years old and suffering from arthritis in her hips. they are helpful on the wood floors, but a bit slick on the packed snow.. she needed a bit of help on the steps and icy pathways. she didn't complain about wearing them, i only gave 4 stars so anyone wanting to buy them knows they aren't as slip proof as others because the sole is harder rubber rather than a non-slip type rubber. worth the money just to help her around the house and keep her tootsies warm in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Sarachel

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 12-Year Old Golden- 5 Barks!
customer_reviews.text: Our 12-year old Golden Retriever started loosing her footing when she got up from a hardwood or tiled floor. Sometimes both back legs, sometimes both front legs. We tried dog socks with traction grip but they wouldn't stay on. These Ultra Paws Durable Dog Boots are great! The two velcro straps go in opposite directions and keep them secured, and our dog seems to like wearing them inside the house. Yesterday she came to me with a tennis ball in her mouth, wanting to play "Fetch"- this was the first time she's done that in a long time. Thank you, Ultra Paws, for giving our dog her mobility again on hardwood floors! They're the
customer_reviews.author: Nittlenny

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 10yr old Doberman. They are a bit tight to get on but once they're on they stay.He's getting a bit weak in his back end and these are helping him be a bit more confident going across the hardwood floors in our house. He had developed an aversion to going into certain areas of the house because of the floors and these are helping him be a little more mobile. They have provided excellent grip on the floors and are easy to wash off since he wears them in the yard as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Works great on 14 year old dog
customer_reviews.text: These stay in position on our 14 yr. old dog and provide good traction on our hardwood floors. Although they are relatively easy to put on, our old dogs hates having her feet messed with, so it is a battle each time we have to put them back on her. I'm very pleased with how the boots stay positioned, the key is to tighten the ankle straps to prevent twisting. Since dogs sweat through their paw pads, I have been reluctant to keep these on her 24-7. since they do not appear to be breathable.
customer_reviews.author: CastAway

customer_reviews.title: Perfect water shoes
customer_reviews.text: We actually use these as water shoes for our Mastiff/Lab mixes. They work great so they don’t scratch the pool liner (or you) when swimming in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Nice durable doggy boots
customer_reviews.text: We walk near the beach where there are sand spurs all over the ground that would get stuck in Dobergal's paws and cause her pain. These boots solved that problem, but she genuinely hates them. On one paw, it wants to get turned around backwards where the top of the boot is under her paw.....not sure what I am doing wrong because that is the only paw I have issues with -- the others fit perfectly and wear well. My dad has painted garage floors that her nails scratch, so she wears the boots over there too. They are well made, durable, and are a great solution to my 2 problem issues.
customer_reviews.author: x

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE - VERY CHEAP, DID NOT LAST 30 DAYS!
customer_reviews.text: Bought them on 12 November 2017. Wore through within one month. Outer coating on the red fabric wore off on all four of the boots nearly at the same time. Puppy is only 35 pounds, and has wider, well padded paws. Skip this item, very cheap!
customer_reviews.author: Chopper John

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: They look comfortable. I used them inside to prevent scratches on the wood floor. My dogs are comfortable wearing them during the day. It sometimes comes off but not too often. Overall I like it.
customer_reviews.author: nasim

customer_reviews.title: A no for a dog with short legs. Measurement instructions do not work.
customer_reviews.text: Don't purchase these if you have a dog with short legs, like a Corgi. I measured according to the website instructions and the boots are a mile to big. I tightened the Velcro strips as tight as I could and nothing helps. I tried to customize them by cutting them shorter. I tried putting little socks on the dog first. aNothing works. They are so much too big they trip my dog. This purchase was such a waste of money. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: patricia mccommas

customer_reviews.title: STOP Looking, These R Da Boots !!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd type of boot for my Pit... 3rd is a Charm...The Large size was 2big/wide (she's 60 lbs). The Medium is Perfect... Just make sure you tuck that dew claw inside da boot. I tried 1 on front, 1 on back 2start off. Once she learned how 2walk w/ them on... she's good 2go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit despite following measuring directions.
customer_reviews.text: Despite following the sizing instructions, the Extra Small boots are too big for my dog. They kind of gave him duck feet. He tripped several times the only time he wore them because the foot part is too wide. I'm returning them, and I'm hoping the Petite will fit better in the foot, but not too tight in the leg. I want to take him hiking in the CA hills, and the footing can be quite rough for his feet. He needs reliable protection which won't trip him up.
customer_reviews.author: ND

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I'd been doing a lot of traveling in areas with very high temps so used these at a rest stop where the pavement was scorching hot. These go on easily and stayed on, my dog din't mind wearing them. The quality is good. I never realized that dogs feet sweat so this is the perfect fabric since it breathes !
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be doing the job
customer_reviews.text: One of our dogs didn't like to stay out in the snow because his feet were cold (he kept holding up his feet so that's what we assumed.) We had tried boots like these for another dog and she didn't like them at all but thought we'd try again. The first time we put them on him we couldn't stop laughing at his walking! But after just a few minutes outside he was walking almost normally and running as well as he does without the boots. And he didn't "complain" about the cold. As long as you fasten them well they stay on, even when jumping through snow piles and running through trees.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Like design but velcro is a problem as it doesn't seem to last.
customer_reviews.text: Like the design and bought four pairs for my Lab who scuffs. The problem is that the velco doesn't work for long. Didn't realize there could be such a variation. I washed the boots and made sure they were clean but velcro just seems to give up after only a month's use. Would definitely buy again if velcro issue were resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Jane L Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Originally got the medium after measuring our pups paw. Got them in quickly. His paw was a little to large, quick, easy return and reordered in large. Excellent quality. Large is the perfect fit for our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Witt

customer_reviews.title: Don't stay on while swimming, but work well.
customer_reviews.text: These may be good for some water (ie. puddles and things), but don't expect them to stay on if your four legged child goes swimming. These make it difficult for dogs because they fill up with water, drag them down a little, and may come off. Fortunately, they float! Work well on rocks, gravel drives, and coarse concrete. I guess my 80-ish black lab has small paws, because a medium fit him pretty well (maybe a tad snug).
customer_reviews.author: Jadeddust

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome! I have a 100lb yellow lab and these fit great. He loves them! He runs around in the deep snow fast, chasing the frisbee and they've never fallen off. The foam at the opening is great and prevents snow from going inside. All other boots I've tried have fallen off. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: With that said despite the size issue he did keep them on the best he could and after about 20 minutes of walking ...
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with these was sizing...i have a large 90 lb. boxer with big paws so I had no idea what size to order. I ordered a XL blindly and they were too big, still not sure if he needs a large or medium... With that said despite the size issue he did keep them on the best he could and after about 20 minutes of walking like bambi he was fine in them if the would've just stayed on...they just folded under too much being too big. Product would have worked/need size guide
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor dogs that can handle wearing
customer_reviews.text: My dog isn't a fan of wearing these and attempts to pull them off at every opportunity. Not the fault of the boots. He just doesn't like things covering his feet.
customer_reviews.author: John Murray

customer_reviews.title: My problem with this boot . . . .
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a 75# lab needing traction on our tile floors. The concept is great in that it stays in place, it doesn't twist around the paw The material is sturdy They have velcro straps Washable The problem my boy had with them is: Seams sewn on both sides as opposed to up center, the exposed seam rubbed a blister where his dew claw had been removed when he was a pup The material was a bit too sturdy The construction could use a bit more design in fitting the paw as opposed to being a flat piece of material Please keep working on the design . . . .
customer_reviews.author: pmm

customer_reviews.title: Most durable
customer_reviews.text: We use these for our collie mix because our clay soil gets packed in her long, hairy paws. We tried several versions before this style and brand. All of them wore out within a month. These have lasted more than a year with no rips or tears and fit her elongated collie paws.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Lizzy loves her new shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: These dog booties are great. They're sized as shown and are really easy to put on. Our other dog wears another brand and it's a struggle to put them on...not with these. I was afraid that our dog would hesitate walking in them and she did for about 20 seconds and then walked like she'd been wearing them forever. We boat with our dogs and these will give great traction getting off and on the boat. It also makes getting up/down the dock ramps with the sharp metal grating down the center at many state parks much easier. And Lizzy looks really cute in her new red shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: DucksTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best of all dog bootie options
customer_reviews.text: They are tough to fit and the dog walks funny in them, but out of all I've tried they work the best. Keeps salt off paws and they stay warmer. We don't bother with them except on long walks because they are a struggle to out in our pups feet
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Work good
customer_reviews.text: These work great. My dog took a little bit to get used to them. They do slide off once in a while when she is running, but otherwise they work great.
customer_reviews.author: slillge

customer_reviews.title: Boots are better than no boots at all.
customer_reviews.text: The boots are just what they were advertised to be. But, we found out they are not for use on ice. Our dog had no traction at all. We originally bought them to use when the temperatures are very cold and the ice is hard on her dog paw pads. We are saving them for muddy conditions to keep her Yellow Labrador paws clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy's Gardens

customer_reviews.title: And are relatively easy to put on as well
customer_reviews.text: I thought there was no chance my dog would wear shoes, but in the snow I had to try. These stay on! And are relatively easy to put on as well! My dog is a 10 pound yorkie and the XS is the perfect size, a little extra space, not too tight in the feet. (To get him to walk in them in the snow for the first time I carried him away from the apartment and then put him down so he had to walk back---TA DA! He walks!)
customer_reviews.author: logan

customer_reviews.title: They are the best! I've tried at least four other brands
customer_reviews.text: Saha, my Arthritic German Shepherd wears these on her back paws to get around on my hardwood floors. They are the best! I've tried at least four other brands, but they all slid off... These stay on because of the double velcro. We highly recommend these booties for all our friends who need them on hardwoods or outside :) She wore them in the snow as well.. Waterproof and as long as the velcro is snug, snow won't get in the boots.
customer_reviews.author: chort1313

customer_reviews.title: Work great, but take care of the fit.
customer_reviews.text: I have a large German Shepard I took the large size boots that just barely fit his front paws and are almost too large for his back paws. The fastening system works well with this situation. He doesn't mind putting them on and has no problem walking or running in them - he does loose some traction. He has a tendency to drag his paws during his walk so I used Shoe Goo to patch the tips and he keeps on trucking. We have only walked 20 miles roads, sidewalks, and a lot of rock salt. The bottoms hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Dezzie

customer_reviews.title: Issues with fit
customer_reviews.text: The paws of my 85 lb lab were slightly over 2.75 in, so I ordered the large. It may be helpful for other dog owners to know that the large is 4.0 inches across. Thus, for a dog with 3.0 in paws, the overhang of material on both sides of the paw can predispose the dog to trip. I am returning and ordering the medium, in hopes that it is actually slightly larger than 2.75 in, and thus a better fit. Another issue is the lack of a heel pocket: perhaps a materials engineer can recommend a material that would, when warmed or stretched, conform to the contours of a foot?
customer_reviews.author: DHEP

customer_reviews.title: Great Booties!
customer_reviews.text: These dog booties are awesome! They are the 3rd time we have tried to find a bootie that works. And this is it! Our dog sits patiently while I put them on and one of the best features, in my opinion, is that the 2 Velcro straps go in different directions and the spacing of the straps ensures a secure fit given the angles of dogs paws! These are GREAT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Boots
customer_reviews.text: My dog keeps these boots on. The velcro holds them in place. I ordered the medium for her and they fit perfectly. She is an Australian Shepherd-Poodle mix and weighs about 45 pounds. She doesn't seem to mind them at all and leaves them on. I let her walk around with just one on for awhile, then two until all four of them were on her. She did "wave" at first and looked like a Tennessee Walking horse, but she seemed to adjust to them quickly and even seems to like them.I would highly recommend them...great product.
customer_reviews.author: reader 1 me

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by how well they stayed on my dogs. We purchased these boots to attempt to provide some additional protection to our hardwood floors. They worked well while they were on, but my dogs are feisty, and eventually chewed the boots off. They lasted longer Than was reasonably expecting, and the "chewing off" is a reflection on my dogs, not the boots. Anything made of fabric, even tough material like these boots, can eventually be overcome by insistent animal teeth. 5 stars nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Devin J. Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Good for traction, but causing other problems
customer_reviews.text: I got these boots for my German Shepherd who is scuffing and dragging his toes due to nerve damage. The boots fit well and protect his nails (which had previously worn down to the point of bleeding). They also offer great traction on hardwood and linoleum floors, where he has the most difficulty with slipping and maintaining balance. However, the drawback is that the top seam (where the rubbery portion meets the nylon portion)rubs on the tops of his toes and has caused painful lesions. I'm not sure what to do... he needs the traction help and foot protection, but this boot is causing a new source of pain for my poor pup who is already suffering enough.
customer_reviews.author: Ann C.

customer_reviews.title: Booties for your Pet
customer_reviews.text: We recently relocated to Florida, and have a pool. Our dog took to the pool and playing in it right away. All her running around the pool ground her nails down till one of them bled. We bought these Ultra Paws for her to wear until her feet healed, and she got used to the surface around the pool. The intent of the boots aren't for this use, but they worked great. The bottoms of the boots are slip resistant which also added in her still running around the pool. Try them if you have nail issues on your pets feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H. Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Large too small for wide paws...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, and once on stay on! I did buy these for my large labradoodle with a thick wool coat. I measured as instructed but they were too narrow for his feet. Fortunately I have another labradoodle with narrower feet and they fit him perfectly. But I didn't really need them for him, the snow doesn't get caught in his paws like the other one, but will keep for long hikes and travels to hot climates. I do like the quality so much that I bought a second set in XLG.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but run big
customer_reviews.text: These work great for taking the dog rafting on the river so she doesn't pop it. They run big however. I measured according to the instructions but they were wider than expected. I was able to send my first set back for a full refund. If your dog is in between sizes, go down, not up.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Marin

customer_reviews.title: These booties are great! My boxer does not tolerate the cold well ...
customer_reviews.text: These booties are great! My boxer does not tolerate the cold well and these really protect here paws from ice and snow AND the toxic salt/ice melt that the city uses. She walks easily in them once we get outside and she forgets she has them on! I would not recommend them for running around to play. I only use them for walks with me. They can trip up and get hurt if running. Important to make sure the Duclaw is tucked in. These booties really stay on nicely. And they are very well made. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Tucker likes his new boots
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and well fitting boots. My dogs have used about 10 pairs of Ruff Wear booties over the years for hiking and water and they are good but, tend to turn on the paws at times. These boots stay straight on the paws.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Not boots at all.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are more like mittens...they don't actually fit to the dog's paw. If my dog were walking on his tip-toes, then maybe these would work. A dog's paw requires an actual shaped boot. They fall off immediately. One 15-minute walk has already worn down the boots. The size chart is not accurate -- I measured my dog's foot at 3 inches and the Large does not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: These are stupid. The sizing is terrible, the velcro is worse than anticipated, these are not durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: A great product for older dogs that difficulty getting up off the floor or to walk on wood floors.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Bought it for my older dog because he was beginning to have trouble with arthritis. Towards the end of his days, these were a life saver, because it gave him some more mobility. The grip that it gave him on the wood floors allowed to him to walk in those last few months. After him, my other dog, developed arthritis issues and had lost a lot of muscle mass. These shoes gave her the same extra mobility and the ability to walk a lot longer than she would have been able to, if she did not have these. She walked in the park until one week before she had to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jane of All

customer_reviews.title: These really work!
customer_reviews.text: Had to get something for my dogs feet...Lots of snow and -0 temperatures. These boots fit the bill. They are durable and stay on! The double velcro straps are adjustable so they can be pulled tight. They are made well and stay in place. Although not custom fit for the dog they do an acceptable job keeping her feet dry and protected from the cold. I'm sure she can still feel cold through them but at least she isn't lifting her paws or laying down to keep her feet off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Crittermom

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working for my intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the rear legs of my dog who has a bad hip. They give him better traction on my floor. They seem like they will be durable. I wish the top velcro band was a bit longer. Being the L size you'd think they'd think about the leg being thick. I wish the foot part was more distinct for I feel they'd fit better. But if they help me to save him from blowing out his hip, it's good enough :) I do have to say my hubs and I almost wet ourselves laughing when I 1st put them on. The dog's walk was hilarious but he very quickly adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: JerzeyGurl

customer_reviews.title: The size fits my pup like as indicated by their size scale
customer_reviews.text: Forced to buy the accompanying socks i guess. The size fits my pup like as indicated by their size scale. However, the boots don't stay on worth a darn, especially the ones on his hind leg paws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They stay on and work great!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only booties that will stay on our toy American Eskimos feet. The dual strap works perfect, and there's a foam pad on the inside that grips the dogs paw and makes it so you don't need the straps super tight for the lot to stay on. The only thing that I would request, to make this 5 stars, is an anti-microbial lining. After a winter of use they're pretty smelly and gross. Also, measure your dogs paw with when they're standing and make sure you get the right size.
customer_reviews.author: EricCBohn

customer_reviews.title: Order a size larger than you think!
customer_reviews.text: Sizing instructions didn't work for me and I ordered a medium for a 60 pound dog base on a 2 1/2 inch paw spread and they are way too small. Boots appear well made though and So I have ordered a size Large, hoping they will work. I "thought" the medium sounded too small for my dog, but the sizing instructions convinced me to order medium anyway! If in doubt, order a size larger is my advice from my experience! Good luck with your pup!
customer_reviews.author: L chandler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for around the house
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our dog who was having a hard time walking on our hardwood floors. We typically put them on when we aren't home to make sure that he will be able to get around. We use them constantly and have absolutely no complaints. They provide ample grip and fit well. We are very pleased with the Ultra Paws Durable Dog Boots.
customer_reviews.author: CE GA

customer_reviews.title: perfect solution for our dog's needs!
customer_reviews.text: for our old english sheepdog this worked out perfectly. we needed a pad that would not slip on daily cleaned wood floors and this was the ticket. fit is excellent (she is about 60 lbs) so we went with large. but what impressed me the most was it has no slip area on the bottom but also has an area on top of the boot that also is no slip just in case it turns over which it does very occasionally. our dog is happy, we are happy and yes if we needed more, this is the one we would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mark Loewenberg

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We have a 10 year old Australian Shepherd who had started having trouble on our linoleum floors. She had slipped so many times that she inched around corners. I did some research and found these boots, figured it was worth trying them. Turns out they hold up to all the good reviews. She has no problems at all walking on the slick floors, wearing the boots on her back legs only. They give her traction and are much easier to clean the mud from than her bare feet. Also, they fit great. She has never had one come off or even get twisted around. Extremely satisfied customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: If your dog drags toes at all these are not for you..
customer_reviews.text: We have an older dog that drags her toes in the rear. These boots were not good for that at all. They didn't last one walk. The slip resistance wasn't very good either. If you want boots just to protect the temperature of your dogs feet these would work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - dog won't tolerate.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those tough reviews to write. The product I received is of good quality. Reasonable stitching and good, long Velcro strips. I have a 165lb Great Dane and it fit his feet. But, as it as sewn as a sock without a real turn for the paws it has a tendency to wrinkle hard on my dogs paw and irritate him to where he will pull it off. I don't want to give it fewer stars because I haven't found anything better yet. I want to give it fewer stars because I can only use it if I keep pestering my dog to not remove it.
customer_reviews.author: jabre

customer_reviews.title: Great for Snowy Walks
customer_reviews.text: These work great for keeping our Tibetan terrier's feet dry and also keeping snow from accumulating on her feet and legs. One drawback is they're not easy to put on, but that also means they don't fall off either. No dog loves to wear booties and it was hilarious to see her high-stepping around trying to get used to the feel of them on her feet.
customer_reviews.author: M&MTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Great boots that stay on!
customer_reviews.text: -Easy to get on/off after a few tries -Stay on very well -Keep the paws protected -Not "fur" lined or anything, but keep my dog's paws warm enough for potty breaks in Minnesota winters -Well constructed, had them for a month or two now and are no worse for wear -Not really grippy, can make for some slipping/tripping on hard/smooth surfaces -Sizing guide was accurate for my dog
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works great for snow
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for snow hikes to keep snow from packing up between my dogs toes. She is about 70 pounds and a trim (not overfed fatty) Golden Retriever. We wrap 3M Vetrap Bandage tape around her ankles and dewclaws first and this seems to help the UltraPaws stay on. For use in snow durability has been excellent, occasionally the velcro has gotten packed with snow requiring some cleaning to get the velcro to stick but overall pretty minor. I would also use these on hiking trails with sharp rocks to provide some extra pad protection. Have not done this yet so cannot comment on durability for those conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: They caused chaffing
customer_reviews.text: They fell off my pup as soon as she started running. I finally managed to get them to stay on her, but then I noticed her paw pads were getting raw. Quite annoyed that I spent $35 on them and now have to spend another $15 for socks?!?! A little ridiculous if you ask me
customer_reviews.author: Lady of the Night

customer_reviews.title: We love these boots
customer_reviews.text: We love these boots. Ruthie does not object to having them put on or to wearing them, In fact I think that she likes them. We are out on the Arizona deserts all of the time and they really protect her feet and her very soft fur. When they wear out we will purchases more. i wou;d definitely recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Loyd

customer_reviews.title: dog HATES these but they keep his paws warm
customer_reviews.text: We got these for my dog last winter and we barely used them. This winter, it was so freaking cold that we couldn't have taken him on walks some days without these, which would have resulted in poop in the house. He is convinced that he can't either lift of set down again whatever paw the boot was just put on. He's very fussy about his feet, but it's for his own good. If we go for a very long walk, he eventually forgets that he's wearing them and everything is fine.
customer_reviews.author: klsyking

customer_reviews.title: Miracles do happen!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our 13 year old golden Lab was really having trouble on tile floors and even outdoors on concrete. He was to the point that he didn't even want to walk across the tile for a treat. We decided to try these. Miracles do happen. Every morning he comes out of our bedroom and lays down on the living room carpet and waits for us to put on his boots. They are WONDERFUL!!!!! We are only using them on his back feet at this point. Just amazing the improvement in his ability to move.
customer_reviews.author: Bunkerhunter

customer_reviews.title: I love my dog but he will have to go without ...
customer_reviews.text: I got a large red boots for my lab. They didnt fit on his paws what at all. It isnt that they are small but they do not form to his paws in a way that ables him to walk normally. I took these off immediately for the ones that actually stayed on. I wouldnt buy these again. I love my dog but he will have to go without something on his paws.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Lee

customer_reviews.title: Finally, quality dog boots!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Bought these in 2013 and am still impressed with these. We bought a small pair for our beagle and medium pair for our lab mix. The beagle doesn't care too much to have them on, but will tolerate them. The lab loves them-he gets so excited when we put them on him. Once they are on, he jumps up and can't wait to get outside to play in the snow. They are a definite must for cold upper Midwest winters. Both pairs still look like new. We tried several other boots before finally discovering Ultra Paws. We couldn't be happier with these!
customer_reviews.author: Misty

product_meta.title: Ultra_Paws Durable Water Resistant Nylon Boots for Dogs - Easy to Put On - Large - 4 PCS - Machine Washable
product_meta.description: * Easy to put on - difficult to slip off! * Split seam sides expand - making it easy to put on the boots. * Two Velcro straps with slides fasten the boots in place. * Small 2 1/4\" width; Medium 2 3/4\" width; Large 3 1/4\" width; * Generous foam at the closures create a secure grip and cushion the dog's paw when the boot is tightened. * Tough, water resistant nylon material with the top of the toe and sole wrapped in Toughtek®, a grippy, flexible, skid resistant and durable thermoplastic material, up to 0.8mm thick. * Toughtek® performs in wet and dry, hot and cold conditions. * Available in six sizes in red or black, in sets of four. How to Measure Your Dogs Foot - To measure the width of your dog's foot, place the foot on a piece of paper and press down on the top of the foot, mimicking how the foot spreads when the dog's walking.Mark the left and the right side of the foot on the paper and measure the distance between the marks. Compare this to the boot sizes. The width of the foot should be smaller than the boot size. For example, if the foot width is 2 1/2 inches, order an Small at 2 3/4 inches.
feature_bullets: MEASURE FIRST: For best dog boot fit, measure dog paws and refer to size guide. Width of dog paw should be less than width of dog booties. Buy large boots for paws measuring between 2 3/4 and 3 1/4 inches. Other sizes available
IDEAL FOR: Running at dog grass runs, dog pools, snow and indoor hardwood floors. Large dog shoe provides paw protection with rubber non slip soles.
UNIQUE DESIGN: Ultra Paws dog shoes with foam ensure your dog is comfortable when velcro straps are tight and secured.
ADDITIONAL USAGE: Use to keep dogs from licking natural dog paw balm, cream or soother. Wear in the rain to keep water away from paws and pads.
BUY ULTRA PAW RUGGED BOOTS for dogs for hiking, hot pavement, mushers with thicker rubber. Rugged Large dog boot is B001W3FR20

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
